name: Death, resignation or removal of guardian of the property
text: The court may remove a guardian of the property for good cause, upon notice and hearing, or accept the guardian's resignation.  After the guardian's death, resignation or removal, the court may appoint another guardian of the property.  A guardian of the property so appointed succeeds to the title and powers of the guardian's predecessor. [L 1976, c 200, pt of §1; gen ch 1985]
